content: I'd like to suggest a track for next connectathon focused around Questionnaire, and it's use for clinical forms

scenarios:
- authoring a questionnaire
- repository for questionnaire
- UI to get a user to fill the questionnaire in
- bonus points: using CDS-hooks to check questionnaire with expert system as it is answered
- storing QuestionnaireResponse
@Lloyd McKenzie @Brian Postlethwaite - would this get enough interest?

I'd like to also see
- populating a QuestionnaireResponse from EHR data based on guidance in the Questionnaire
- generating a Bundle of resources from a QuesitonnaireResponse based on guidance in the Questionnaire
I'm happy to manage the track, but likely wouldn't be bringing any code.
I meant to add the first but wasn't going to propose the second for now
This sounds like something that would be interesting to have in the Integration Track.

I would be interested... but won't be at the next connectathon :(
I'll probably be at the one after that

Can you explain a bit more on what you mean in the "bonus points" item?
@Jason Walonoski what wouldn't be in the integration track? (actually, this one: it's too early, i think)

I think eventually everything is a candidate for the integration track. But not everything needs to be in the integration track at each event. Filling out forms is a regular occurrence in the health system though, which is why it makes sense (to me) as a candidate for early inclusion. But, it depends on what else will be there.
So are we doing this and, if so, who should write it up? (We're going to need to tighten down the expectations a bit if we're going to get interoperability happening.)
we need to do this. definitely. There's people coming to Cologne for this and the clinical notes stream
do you want to write it up? or me?
I wasn't totally clear on what you had in mind. I don't mind being the track facilitator, but might be best if you wrote it up.
ok I'll have a go n the next couple of days
